backlog_items.title: Implement login API endpoint
backlog_items.description: Create POST /api/auth/login endpoint with JWT token generation
acceptance_criteria: The endpoint must accept a POST request with 'username' and 'password' in the request body.
If the credentials are valid, the response must return a 200 status code and a JSON object containing a JWT token.
If the credentials are invalid, the response must return a 401 status code with an appropriate error message.
The JWT token must be signed using a secure algorithm and include necessary claims such as 'sub' (subject) and 'exp' (expiration).
The endpoint must include input validation to ensure 'username' and 'password' are provided and meet defined criteria.
The implementation must include unit tests to verify the functionality of the login endpoint.
The endpoint must log failed login attempts for security monitoring purposes.

backlog_items.title: Create login UI component
backlog_items.description: Build React login form with email and password fields
acceptance_criteria: The login form must include fields for email and password.
The email field must validate the format of the email address.
The password field must mask input characters.
The form must have a 'Submit' button that is disabled until both fields are filled out correctly.
Upon successful submission, the form should trigger a login action.
If the login fails, an appropriate error message should be displayed.
The UI must be responsive and work on both desktop and mobile devices.
The component must be styled according to the existing application design guidelines.

backlog_items.title: Write API integration tests
backlog_items.description: Test login API with valid and invalid credentials
acceptance_criteria: Test case for successful login with valid credentials returns a 200 status code and a valid token.
Test case for login with invalid username returns a 401 status code with an appropriate error message.
Test case for login with invalid password returns a 401 status code with an appropriate error message.
Test case for login with empty username returns a 400 status code with an appropriate error message.
Test case for login with empty password returns a 400 status code with an appropriate error message.
Test case for login with SQL injection attempts returns a 400 status code with an appropriate error message.

backlog_items.title: Design login page mockup
backlog_items.description: Create UI/UX design for login page
acceptance_criteria: The login page mockup includes fields for username and password.
The design incorporates a 'Forgot Password?' link.
The login button is prominently displayed and clearly labeled.
The mockup is responsive and displays correctly on both desktop and mobile devices.
The color scheme and typography align with the overall branding guidelines.
User feedback mechanisms (like error messages) are included in the design.
The mockup is delivered in a format compatible with design tools (e.g., Figma, Sketch).

backlog_items.title: Implement password reset API
acceptance_criteria: The API endpoint POST /api/auth/reset-password must accept a JSON payload containing a valid email address.
If the email address is associated with a user account, a password reset link should be sent to that email address.
If the email address is not associated with any user account, the API should return a 404 status code with an appropriate error message.
The API should validate the email format and return a 400 status code for invalid email formats.
The response should include a success message when the email is sent successfully.
The API should implement rate limiting to prevent abuse (e.g., limit to 5 requests per hour per IP address).
The implementation should include unit tests covering all scenarios, including valid and invalid email addresses.

backlog_items.title: Write E2E tests for login flow
acceptance_criteria: The E2E tests cover all scenarios for the login flow, including valid login, invalid login, and password recovery.
Tests should run successfully in a clean environment without any manual intervention.
All tests should be documented with clear instructions on how to run them.
Tests should be integrated into the CI/CD pipeline to ensure they run on every commit.
The tests should provide clear and actionable error messages in case of failure.

backlog_items.title: Validate user input on login form
backlog_items.description: Implement client-side and server-side validation for email and password fields
acceptance_criteria: The email field must accept valid email formats and reject invalid formats with an appropriate error message.
The password field must enforce a minimum length of 8 characters and must include at least one uppercase letter, one lowercase letter, one number, and one special character.
Client-side validation must provide real-time feedback as the user types in the email and password fields.
Server-side validation must also check the email and password fields and return appropriate error messages if validation fails.
Both client-side and server-side validations must be tested with various valid and invalid inputs to ensure robustness.

backlog_items.title: Create password reset UI component
backlog_items.description: Build React form for entering email to receive password reset link
acceptance_criteria: The UI component must include an input field for the user to enter their email address.
The email input field must have proper validation to ensure it is in a valid email format.
There must be a 'Submit' button that is disabled until a valid email is entered.
Upon submission, the UI should display a success message indicating that a password reset link has been sent, or an error message if the email is not found.
The component must be styled according to the existing design system.
The component should be responsive and function correctly on both desktop and mobile devices.
The component must include accessibility features, such as appropriate ARIA labels and keyboard navigation.

backlog_items.title: Test password reset flow
backlog_items.description: Write integration and E2E tests for the password reset process
acceptance_criteria: Integration tests cover all API endpoints involved in the password reset process, including request and validation.
E2E tests simulate the entire user journey for password reset, from requesting a reset link to successfully updating the password.
Tests should validate error handling for invalid email addresses and expired reset tokens.
All tests should run successfully in the CI/CD pipeline without any failures.
Documentation is updated to reflect the testing strategy and any new test cases added.

backlog_items.title: Delete Account feature
backlog_items.description: Perform heuristic evaluation of UI for login and password reset pages, suggest improvements
acceptance_criteria: Heuristic evaluation is completed for both login and password reset pages.
At least 5 usability issues are identified and documented for each page.
Each identified issue includes a suggested improvement or solution.
A summary report is created that outlines the findings and recommendations.
Stakeholder review of the report is conducted and feedback is incorporated.
